name: OZO George Town Penang
detail: This newly built hotel is in the heart of Georgetown - within walkable distance to various night food markets. The view from the hotel is also magnificent, especially the view from the pool. I booked a family room however only realized at site that it is actually two individual rooms connected via a connecting door. And the connecting doors between two rooms open at a weird angle and no door stopper was provided - hence would recommend getting the suite instead for better and more comfortable stay. Check in process was extremely slow most likely due to the crowd during the christmas weekend. However I was extremely unsatisfied with the way the receptionist handled the situation. First I was informed upon arrival at 3.30PM (Noted check in opens at 3PM on the website) that the room will be available in 10 minutes. And yet my family and I waited for an extra 40 minutes until 4.20PM for the rooms. And there were no updates from the receptionist in between the wait. In the end I voiced out my unsatisfactory to the hotel team and was then only been provided with free breakfast for the next morning. In my humble opinion I appreciate honesty in customer service. The receptionist should be honest with the waiting time in order for customers to then make better choices with this spare time - we could have spent the waiting time at a nearby cafe/tourist attraction site instead. This was the only downfall of my stay. Otherwise the check out process was smooth, the hotel's rooms are great, parking is provided with automated car park and other hotel staffs I encountered were friendly and helpful too.

name: Bayview Hotel Georgetown
detail: 1st time we came to Penang, we stayed here because of the location. It is at the very top of jalan penang and there are so many things around. Bars behind the hotel, places to eat within 2 minutes walk, street market within 3 minutes and at the end of the street market, shopping centers are pretty much accross the road! Although there are other hotels that are located on jalan penang itself, bayview still wins hands down on location. The fact that its at the top of the street means a slightly quieter atmosphere. I mean, you don't want to step out of the hotel 1st thing in the morning to see some locals sleeping on the street, do you? Because that's what you'd get if you stay at the hotels on jalan penang. The band they constantly have performing each night is very good too. Sometimes after a hot day walking around or shopping or whatever you do in penang, you just want to relax and have a drink or two and listen to the band singing your all time favourites and do shout outs when you request a song (or 10!). We came back to penang a year later. And even though we originally wanted to stay in a resort around batu ferringhi, we decided we loved bayview the 1st time and we'd show that appreciation by returning. And were we glad we did. We arrived in the island quite late and was exhausted. We checked in at about 11:30 pm and Izhan (forgot the spelling of the name) asked if this was our first time in penang, so we told him we were there the previous year. After what seemed like 5 seconds, he thanked us for returning to bayview and upgraded us from superior room to premier! That's not even the next level of room up (superior then deluxe then premier then suite). At 11:30 at night after a long flight, I don't ever remember having much energy but I was jumping up and down. So thank you! Overall, aside from location, value, facilities available and all other things they advertise, experience like mine is not something you always get at other hotels. Thumbs up

name: Ascott Gurney Penang
detail: Spending an afternoon in the swimming pool is so relaxing.

name: G Hotel Kelawai
detail: My 1st time in penang, hotel staff greeted us with some icecream. Fast check in process. At checkin they gave us twin beds, but i requested a king size which they very quickly magically transformed our twin into one large bed. Location - omg convenient. Literally 2 mins walking distance to either Gurney plaza (left?) or Gurney paragon (right?). There's plenty of coffeeshops there & places to shop. Facility - pool is kind of small. A nice terrace for drinks overlooking the whole of george town.

name: Fifth Avenue Hotel
detail: Hotel is new, the staffs were great and friendly.

name: Hotel Penaga
detail: first time staying at peranakan boutique hotel in penang, i believe panaga is the best among all! when i first arrived at the hotel entrance, first sight of this old corner heritage building has already amazed me! designed by famous local architect hijjas kasturi, he make sure every corner of this hotel will suprise you! 3storey building, different theme disgin of every floor and every room! perfectly matching of old & new, give you such wonderful experince of stay! i like the traditional wooden blind window, allows perfect natural lighting shine into your room! try to request to stay on 3rd floor, extream high ceiling and nice deco. breakfast is awesome, especially the various of traditional nyonya kuih, ensure you fall into truly peranakan feeling. the small swimming is nice, best to chill yourself during hot weather.

name: Cititel Express Penang Hotel
detail: I book a family room with Citiel express Penang Hotel. The room was separated into two room one queen size bed and two single bed. I like the concept of the room. The location is good got a lot of nice food nearby. If I go travel to Penang will book Citiel express Penang Hotel again.

name: St. Giles Wembley Penang
detail: St.Giles is tallest hotel in penang, view from our room is KOMTAR Building, and sea. My daughter love to stay in this hotel because they have free popcorn in reception. This hotel is very near to 1st avenue mall, and this mall connected to komtar and prangin mall, just walk turn right. If you turn left, we can get to GAMA supermarket, which have cheaper prices than others and also we can go to new lane food hawkers, macalister road zim sum which sell dim sum, atek durian...etc. Easy check in and check out. My daughter

name: Royale Chulan Penang
detail: Our stay at The Royale Bintang Penang Hotel was a really enjoyable stay. The hotel is very conveniently located to anything and everything you would want to see. The rooms are clean and spacious. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The restaurant also provides a very comprehensive and well rounded morning buffet. The manager who greeted and seated us was especially pleasant and it was a nice welcome. I would also like to say that management is also very pleasant. I wanted to mention this because we ran into a nicely dressed gentlemen who must have been the general manager in the elevator and then outside the restaurant. I am sorry I didn't get his name, but he took time to explain some of the history of his hotel. His warm and friendly manner was greatly appreciated. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes to have a memorable stay in Penang.

name: Gurney Bay Hotel, A PARKROYAL Partner Hotel
detail: One of the best hotels in Penang. Hotel is quite old nut you don't feel it at all as it well maintained and kept by staff. Location is really best near to Gurty walk with easy access to all the well known locations of the island. Car park is quite comfortable and there is always available parking bay.
